file_content.text: Accept your hand? I'd sooner thrust my fist into a thresher.
I... I don't understand. I thought this had already been arranged, approved?
Advocate, be so kind as to remove this thing from my presence.
I'm not your bouncer.
Not my job.
Anything for a lady.
[Flirt] My pleasure.
Look at the bright side, tubby, bouncing back is probably something you're good at.
Move it, fats.
Kindness doesn't pay. Try again.
What do I get out of this?
You would have this thug manhandle me?
Ugh. Fine, I'll pay you. Just get this insufferable swine out of here!
You heard the lady.
You've got a deal.
Come on, fat bag, she ain't interested.
Time to kiss the curb, tubby.
T--this must be some kind of mistake. Oof!
Well, that was at least worth the week's pocket money. I hope you know what to do with that much.
I'll try not to spend it all in one place.
I'll manage.
This is going straight into the ammo and explosives fund.
Trust me, I do.
I'll get something to remember you by, like blaster targets with your face on them.
I can figure it out, you snob.
How sweet, I'll try not to forget you the moment I turn my head.
The nerve of Zacar, and my father! Treating me like some insipid... simpering... urgh!
How many more of these absurd marriage proposals must I endure?
You people've got a funny definition of romance.
They definitely lack charm.
Romance? Marriage is the currency of politics. It is customary to gift one's children for favors.
We've got a word for that on Nar Shaddaa. It's called "slavery."
Were you marriageable, I think you'd find that there is some distinction.
I, however, make my own decisions. I will not be bandied about like some parcel of land, to fuel my cousin's ambitions.
Good day, advocate.
If you made yourself undesirable, they'd go away.
I'd recommend a scandal.
You make a good point, advocate. What did you have in mind?
Start some rumors. See what happens.
Just get people talking.
Not exactly the stuff of brilliance, but it's a start.
Bet a fling with a notorious bounty hunter'd send them all running.
[Flirt] Rumors of an affair?
Please tell me you're not serious.
Just advising the lady of her options.
I'm her advocate, that's it.
All right, just keep it that way.
No harm in flirting.
Uh-huh, sure you were. If you're done playing footsie, can we please get back to work?
It was an intriguing suggestion. Pity. I'll leave you to your babysitting.
I don't exactly do a lot dating up. Back in a few, kid.
Oh yeah. I'm serious.
Let's not hurry, I'll send a governess to ensure she doesn't choke on something small and shiny.
How convenient that I happen to have one at hand, all that's missing is a suitable arena for attracting gossip.
Be so kind as to escort me through the gardens, advocate.
I'll just loiter around here, maybe look for... souvenirs.
Okay, I'll just be here... watching the Great Hunt slip through our fingers.
Well, after that performance, I expect House Thul to be alive with rumor for some time.
I like to exceed expectations.
Glad I could help.
That much was apparent.
Trust me, I don't think it was my performance anybody noticed.
You weren't half bad yourself.
It certainly was an invigorating stroll, wasn't it?
And here I thought you'd be a cold fish.
Nice prude act you had going.
Let's just say that I believe I finally understand Raffid's atrocious behavior.
Here's a little something for your "counsel."
I never pegged you for a smooth talker, but I gotta say, that was slick.
Ugh, I think I'm going to be sick.
I'll be seeing you, advocate.
Find a touchy feely guy with a loud mouth, problem solved.
Fool around with someone.
Hardly ideal, but I suppose I can suffer one more suitor if it sends the rest packing.
Tell everyone you paid me to kill the next fop that comes bothering you.
Broadcast some threats.
Hardly subtle, but it should have the desired effect.
You're surprisingly clever. Perhaps my uncle's faith in you was not misguided.
Here is a little something for your counsel. Good day, advocate.
Do I get a kiss for all my hard work?
[Flirt] How about a thank you?
Oh my, yes. Such abundance of masculinity has me in palpations.
Your feeble attempts to woo me are refreshingly bad, my thanks for a momentary chuckle.
For a witch like you? Probably a lot of them.
They're your only shot, sister.
I'm sure your suitors only sniff to see if you're in season.
I'll pass, have fun trying to roll him out the door.
I've got better things to do.
Hmph, I suppose insolence is to be expected from one of your sparse social graces.
As for you, if I find you here when I return, I'll have the cook skewer and baste you.
D--does this mean I should cancel the ceremony?
Dunno, I ain't stickin' around to deal with them.
I'm done here.
Yes, I suppose you've served adequately enough.
